resources.string: Had A history of travel to the areas with presumed ongoing community transmission of COVID-19?
A close physical contact in the past 14 days prior to symptom onset with aconfirmed case of COVID-19?
Visit to or attended a healthcare facility where patients with confirmed COVID-19 were admitted
Working in a a healthcare facility that had Quarantine in the last two weeks
Clinical sign and Symptoms: Cough (new or worsening)?
Clinical sign and Symptoms: Shortness of breath (new or worsening)?
Clinical sign and Symptoms: Sore throat and/or runny nose?
Clinical sign and Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting and/or diarrhea?
Clinical sign and Symptoms: Chronic renal failure, CAD/heart failure?

You are OK!! We hope that anyone who develops symptoms that include coughing, runny nose, fever, and sore throat will self-quarantine for 14 days.\n To protect yourself in public places, please wash your hands frequently and intensively, and keep at least 2 meters from the surrounding people.

You must inform MD for assessment, COVID-19 testing should be done only according to case definition, go directly to the emergency department, or visit clinics. 
 Please do a self-quarantine until the results of your analyses become available. 
 Self-isolation means not going to public places, staying at home and not meeting visitors.
 Do not share personal items such as dishes, utensils, and towels, and wash your hands occasionally.

You should inform your MD for assessment, testing should be done only according to case definition. Please do not go to the emergency department, or visit clinics unless those symptoms worsen. 
 Please do a self-quarantine until the results of your analyses become available. 
 Self-isolation means not going to public places, staying at home and not meeting visitors.
 Do not share personal items such as dishes, utensils, and towels, and wash your hands occasionally.
